content: the sugar shawl is an asymmetric shawl featuring our newest lace weight base sugar in this pattern sugar is held double to achieve a fingering weight gauge we ve paired it with elmer fingering and the resulting fabric is insanely soft and cuddly the sugar shawl combines garter stitch with slip_stitch bands adding texture and interest it is the perfect shawl for experimenting with new base pairings additionally it s lightweight which makes it a great option for transitional weather or a slight breeze in the air sample shown mc elmer fingering in color unsalted cc sugar in color plaid is my favorite color sizes one size finished measurements 72 /180cm wingspan x 30 /75cm deep at side edge yarn requirements please note these are yarn estimates the amount used will depend on yarn your personal gauge and any modifications you make mc dimond laine elmer fingering 70% merino 30% cashmere 410 yards per 100g skein 2 skeins cc dimond laine sugar 50% cashmere 27% merino 23% silk 820 yards per 100g 1 skein or the following yardage mc 820 yds/745m of fingering weight yarn cc 577 yds/525m of lace weight yarn suggested needles needles listed are suggested always take time to swatch gauge needle size us 5 32 circular needle or longer or size necessary to obtain gauge tools tapestry needle gauge 24 stitches and 32 row=4 /10 cm using gauge needle in garter stitch blocked *this pattern has been professionally tech edited * 1 https //thelambandkid com/collections/dyed-to-order
